marketNews.title: Signal from Himbara to Provide Funding for 3 Million-House Program
marketNews.content: On Wednesday, February 26, the Chairman of the Housing Task Force and younger brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, signaled that the government will require the state-owned banks (Himbara) to provide financing for the 3-million-house-per-year construction program planned by the government. He said he heard there will be an order for Himbara to support the program, with related regulations currently under discussion among decision-making officials. The statement followed Minister of State-Owned Enterprises Erick Thohir’s request earlier this month for Himbara to play an active role, and he also hopes private banks will support the program. State-owned Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) announced that its President Director Nixon L. P. Napitupulu said in December 2024 that the bank plans to issue bonds worth around IDR 10-15 trillion in 2025 to meet the increased liquidity financing facilities for housing (FLPP). The government plans to raise the FLPP quota from 220,000 units in 2024 to 800,000 units in 2025, requiring a budget of IDR 80 trillion. The 2025 state budget allocates IDR 18 trillion for FLPP liquidity and injects working capital to PT Sarana Multigriya Finansial to channel 220,000 mortgages at a 5% loan rate for a 20-year tenor. On Thursday, February 27, Housing Task Force member Bonny Z. Minang said the 2025 FLPP quota was increased to 420,000, with the additional budget to be disbursed gradually. The Himbara involvement discussion comes as the government seeks to expand FLPP subsidies via government bond issuance. Although the amount of bonds to be issued is unknown, Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said last week that Bank Indonesia will purchase the bonds in the secondary market. Hashim claimed that Bank Indonesia has agreed to provide IDR 130 trillion to support the 3-million-house program, though he did not detail the scheme. Bank Indonesia previously announced a step-up of housing-related KLM incentives from IDR 23 trillion to about IDR 80 trillion effective 1 April 2025. Hashim said the 3-million-house project will start in April 2025, coinciding with an investment of US$18-20 billion from Qatar’s Qilaa International Group.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway on Potential Margin and Asset-Quality Impact of Mandatory Himbara Housing Funding
marketNews.content: If the requirement is imposed, we anticipate that banks belonging to Himbara could face margin and asset-quality uncertainty from financing the program, especially BBRI, BMRI, and BBNI, which have not traditionally focused on mass-housing financing like BBTN. Margin uncertainty will depend on financing rates, funding schemes, and cost of funds, while asset quality will be affected by financing scheme, tenor, and borrower selection criteria. Overall, the uncertainty could generate short-term negative sentiment.

marketNews.title: U.S. President Donald Trump Announces Planned 25% Tariff on EU Imports
marketNews.content: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday, February 26, that he plans to impose a 25% import tariff on the European Union in the near future, without detailing the specifics. He said the tariff would apply to cars and all other goods. It is unclear whether this EU tariff is part of a broader commodity-specific tariff plan or a separate policy covering all products from the bloc. Earlier, Trump also announced a 25% tariff on imports of cars, medicines, semiconductors, and wood.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg: Trump’s Confusing Statements on Import-Tariff Timing and Scope
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that President Trump gave contradictory statements on Wednesday, February 26, about the timing and scope of several planned import-tariff measures. He said tariffs on Canada and Mexico would start on March 4, 2025, then later said April 2, 2025, the date the U.S. Trade Ministry is expected to announce its reciprocal-tariff study results. It is unclear whether the Canada/Mexico tariffs are part of a retaliation package or a separate policy.

marketNews.title: Attorney General’s Office Clarifies Pertamina Corruption Loss Estimate
marketNews.content: Harli Siregar, Head of the Legal Information Center of the Attorney General’s Office, clarified on Wednesday, February 26, that the state loss of IDR 193.7 trillion from the 2018-2023 Pertamina oil-product corruption case is an estimate for 2023 only. He said the total loss from the 2018-2023 cases may still increase as deeper calculations continue. The Attorney General’s Office has named Maya Kusmaya and Edward Corne as new suspects, bringing the total number of suspects to nine. Director of Investigation Abdul Qohar said Maya allegedly ordered the blending of RON 88 with RON 92 to produce RON 92 gasoline.

marketNews.title: Energy Minister Announces Ban on Crude-Oil Exports and Shortened Fuel-Import Licence Period
marketNews.content: Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said on Wednesday, February 26, that the government will ban the export of crude oil and shorten the fuel-import licence period from one year to six months, following a corruption case in a Pertamina subsidiary that sparked a “Pertamax” blending scandal.

marketNews.title: Government to Set Coal Benchmark Price Twice Monthly Starting 1 March 2025
marketNews.content: The government will set the Coal Benchmark Price (HBA) twice a month, on the 1st and 15th, to reflect more up-to-date pricing for export contracts. The change, announced by the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources on February 26, will take effect on 1 March 2025, with exporters still allowed to use existing long-term contract prices but encouraged to adjust if contracts permit.

marketNews.title: Hashim Djojohadikusumo Calls for Corporate Tax Rate Reduction to 18%
marketNews.content: Advisor and President Prabowo’s brother, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said the government will not raise taxes and will seek to boost state revenue by optimizing the shadow-economy. He personally wants the corporate income-tax rate to fall from 22% to 18%, a request he conveyed directly to Deputy Finance Minister Anggito Abimanyu.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Signs Regulation to Create State Revenue Agency
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto secured the establishment of the State Revenue Agency under Presidential Regulation No. 12/2025, part of the 2025-2029 National Medium-Term Development Plan, aiming to raise the tax-to-GDP ratio to 23% of GDP. The agency was previously cancelled when Sri Mulyani returned as Finance Minister.

marketNews.title: Hashim Says Government Aims for US$20 Billion Annual Budget-Efficiency Savings
marketNews.content: Hashim Djojohadikusumo said the government plans to achieve an annual budget-efficiency saving of about US$20 billion (≈ IDR 328 trillion) and to invest the saved funds in the Danantara Investment Management Agency. Earlier, President Prabowo said the initial tranche would be allocated to Danantara amounting to US$20 billion.

marketNews.title: Petrosea Signs IDR 4 Trillion Mining-Services Contract
marketNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) signed a mining-services contract worth about IDR 4 trillion with PT Bara Prima Mandiri and PT Niaga Jasa Dunia, non-affiliated entities. The contract runs until 31 December 2032, with an estimated 135.5 million bcm of cover-layer production and about 7.5 million tonnes of coal.

tickerNews.title: ASII 2024: Net Profit Beats Estimates, Final Dividend Proposed at Rp308
tickerNews.content: Astra International reported net profit of IDR 8.2 trillion in 4Q24 (+1% YoY, –18% QoQ), bringing 2024 net profit to IDR 34 trillion (+1% YoY), equal to 106% of consensus. The financial-services segment and profit from associate and JV entities were the main drivers. Operating profit of the financial-services segment grew +11% YoY and +4% QoQ; profit from associates and JVs grew +13% YoY despite a –8% QoQ decline. Tax expense fell 9% YoY in 4Q24 and 3% YoY for the year. Management proposed a final dividend of IDR 308 per share, implying a 6.7% dividend yield based on the Thursday (27/2) price of IDR 4,590.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors (UNTR) 4Q24 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: United Tractors reported net profit of IDR 3.9 trillion in 4Q24 (-35% QoQ, -25% YoY), resulting in 2024 net profit of IDR 19.5 trillion (-5.2% YoY), equal to 101% of consensus. Revenue in 4Q24 was IDR 34.9 trillion (-0.5% QoQ, +13% YoY), and 2024 revenue grew 4.5% YoY to IDR 134 trillion.

tickerNews.title: Indo Tambangraya Megah (ITMG) 4Q24 Results
tickerNews.content: Indo Tambangraya Megah reported net profit of US$101 million in 4Q24 (-29.8% QoQ, +7% YoY), bringing 2024 net profit to US$374 million (-25.2% YoY), matching the consensus at 101.7%/101.6%. Quarterly revenue rose 6.5% QoQ with volume up 9.5% QoQ while average selling price fell 3.1% QoQ. Cost of mining fell 6.6% QoQ and coal-purchase cost -17.2% QoQ, lifting gross margin to 35% (vs 33.6% in 3Q24). Other-income loss turned to a US$31 million loss versus a US$32 million gain in 3Q24, due to currency loss.

tickerNews.title: ADMR Shares Purchased by Parent ADRO
tickerNews.content: Adaro Adro (ADMR) bought 109 million shares of ADMR at an average price of IDR 965 per share, completing the transaction on 21 February 2025 for a total value of about IDR 105.2 billion. The holding company’s stake in ADMR increased from ~83.8% to ~84.1%.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Directors Buy 45k & 20k Shares
tickerNews.content: Two BBCA directors—John Kosasih (45,000 shares) and Santoso (20,000 shares) bought 45,000 and 20,000 BBCA shares at average prices of IDR 8,875 and 8,900 respectively on 25 February 2025, for total transaction values of roughly IDR 400 million and 178 million. Their holdings-percentage ≈ 0.001% and 0.-0.002% each.
